page.title: 17A TOUR ROUND ROTTINGDEAN
page.content: The village of Rottingdean is a popular attrction for summer visitors in particular. The five miles fro Brighton is well served by open-topped buses terminating at the White Horse Hotel as did the horsedrawn buses earlier in the century. The attractions include the village green and pond; the Norman church of St. Margarets, whose tower still bears the scars of the burning of the villagers by French pirates in the fourteenth century; the picturesque architecture, including the homes of Enid Bagnold and Rudyard Kipling. Open air swimming pools and recreational facilities and the beach and downland complete scene.
